questionData.qText:
Which of the following will help us achieve marketing effectiveness?
Select all that apply.
questionData.fbText: All these statements demonstrate marketing effectiveness. We’ve got the best marketers in the industry, and you’re one of them

answers.text: Having robust measurement and evaluation processes
Developing marketing programmes that implement scale
Maximising return on marketing investment by using the Marketing Catalyst Growth Driver Module
Taking decisions based on data and facts

questionData.qText:
What do we mean by Peak Performance?
Select all that apply
questionData.fbText: Peak Performance is defined by using the allocated resources for your brands in the best possible way. In practice, this means focusing on the small improvements that we can make on every activity and process at work

answers.text: Focusing on the small improvements we can make on every work activity
Concentrating on the most high-profile sales
Using our allocated resources in the best possible way
Using Market Catalyst to manage our customer relationships

questionData.qText:
Which of these do we use to assess marketing effectiveness?
Select all that apply.
questionData.fbText: We assess marketing effectivenss through behaviour and performance. Together they help us achieve Peak Performance

answers.text: Sales ability
Behaviour
Available resources
Performance

questionData.qText: What is the performance equation?
questionData.fbText: The performance equation is a simple way of highlighting areas to consider when selling or helping to sell.

answers.text: A method for highlighting areas to consider when selling or helping to sell
A method of calculating ROI
A method to forecast the impact of your marketing plan
A method to forecast your sales

questionData.qText: Which of the following will help us build a robust understanding of what works and evaluate what we've done so far?
questionData.fbText: Our decisions should be based on facts, not just ‘gut feelings’. By asking the right questions and using accurate data, we will be able to make better decisions that optimise our return on investments.

answers.text: Using the right data
Asking the right questions
Making the right decisions
Using Market Catalyst Growth Driver Module

questionData.qText: How are Growth Drivers indicated in the Marketing Catalyst GDM?
questionData.fbText: The plan for each brand is made up of one or several Growth Drivers – they are the coloured bars. Each Growth Driver’s name is written above the bar.

answers.text: Coloured arrows
Coloured bars
Stars
Grey bars

questionData.qText: What's Marketing Catalyst Growth Driver Module?
questionData.fbText: Marketing Catalyst is a world-class online tool designed to put the power of data and analytics in your hands so that it's easier to make the best choices to deliver the best outcomes for your brands

answers.text: An online tool that puts the power of data and analytics in your hands
A process for creating marketing campaigns
An annual marketing event to measure ROI
An internal review system for our marketer

questionData.qText: What's the key to making the commercial impact forecast of the Growth Driver Module work?
questionData.fbText: Marketing Catalyst relies on robust and accurate data to help you ask the right questions and make the right decisions. It draws from years of econometric data to forecast the impact your marketing plans will have.

answers.text: Running a successful campaign
Optimising your spend
Collecting the right data
Winning the best customers

questionData.qText:
Which of the following will Marketing Catalyst Growth Driver Module help you to do?
Select all that apply.
questionData.fbText: Marketing Catalyst is the first of its kind in the industry. It will help you to decide where to invest across your portfolio and choose the right mix of activities to deliver the best outcome for your brands. It will also help you to forecast the impact of your marketing plan

answers.text: Know where to invest across our portfolio
Choose the right mix of activities to deliver the best outcome for your brands
Create successful presentations for prospective customers
Forecast the impact of your marketing plan

questionData.qText:
What is a Growth Driver?
Select all that apply.
questionData.fbText: A Growth Driver is a proven and repeatable set of activities that drive recruitment for a specified situation. They are a combination of mental and physical activities developed for specific opportunities or challenges faced by the brand.

answers.text: A combination of activities to drive both physical and mental availability
A channel used to deliver growth
A proven and repeatable set of activities that drive recruitment for a specified situation
A specific marketing execution within a vehicle that a consumer or shopper will experience

questionData.qText: What are the key aims of Marketing Catalyst Growth Driver Module?
questionData.fbText: We want every decision and every pound we spend to work as hard as possible for us. To do that we need to know where best to invest across our portfolio and how to win over consumers with every single activity.

answers.text: To improve return on investment
To have a clearer view of our activities
To manage our consumer responses
To win over consumers with every single activity

questionData.qText:
Which of the following are examples of vehicles used to deliver a Growth Driver?
Select all that apply.
questionData.fbText: A vehicle is a channel used to deliver a Growth Driver, such as TV, magazines, social media, point of sale and value added packaging.

answers.text: TV
Magazines
Social media
Word of mouth

questionData.qText: How does the Marketing Catalyst demonstrate confidence in ROI and the commercial forecast data?
questionData.fbText: Each vehicle is given a star rating in the brand planning view, to represent the confidence rating for the ROI and commercial forecast data that underpins it.

answers.text: By showing green arrows next to the data
By using a star rating system
By highlighting the successful Growth Driver
By showing grey arrows next to the data

questionData.qText: Which of the following views are available in the Marketing Catalyst Growth Driver tool?
questionData.fbText: The Marketing Catalyst Growth Driver tool has four levels: Portfolio Planning view, Brand Planning view, Growth Driver Planning view and activity view.

answers.text: Vehicle Planning view
Portfolio Planning view
Brand Planning view
Growth Driver Planning view

questionData.qText: Which of these describes the Brand Planning view in the Marketing Catalyst Growth Driver tool?
questionData.fbText: The Brand Planning view gives you an overall sense of your marketing mix, viewing Growth Drivers by vehicle for a specific brand.

answers.text: The homepage, where you can see your marketing plans for the whole brand portfolio
The page where you can get an overall sense of your marketing mix, viewing Growth Drivers by vehicle
The page that shows you all the schedued activities within a Growth Driver

questionData.qText:
What does econometric modelling do?
Select all that apply.
questionData.fbText: Econometric modelling is a statistical modelling technique that uses historical data to analyse the impact of marketing plans, and identifies and quantifies the relationships between sales and its drivers.

answers.text: Put the power of data and analytics in the consumer's hands
Use historical data to analyse the impact of marketing plans
Forecast the impact on pricing
Use only two of the influential factors (drivers) we have on sales to calculate short-term ROI

questionData.qText:
What type of data does the Marketing Catalyst Growth Driver Module need you to input?
Select all that apply?
questionData.fbText: By entering your marketing business plans (MBPs) in Marketing Catalyst Growth Driver Module, you will have the oportunity to grow your business faster by improving return on investment from an individual brand's marketing plan.

answers.text: Marginal gains results
Marketing business plans
Profit reports
ROIs

questionData.qText:
How does Marketing Catalyst Growth Driver Module help us?
Select all that apply.
questionData.fbText: Marketing Catalyst Growth Driver Module helps us in many ways, including providing visibility of what will happen if we increase a budget too much, too fast. Its predictions help us adjust the phasing and duration of different activities within the Growth Driver and indicate the level of confidence you can have in the ROI predictions.

answers.text: It allows us to see what will happen if we increase a budget too much, too fast
It indicates the level of confidence you can have in the ROI predictions
It helps us adjust the phasing and duration of different activities within the Growth Driver
It gives us a view of the wider economy

questionData.qText: Who can upload and optimise your marketing business plans on the Marketing Catalyst Growth Driver Module?
questionData.fbText: Marketing Catalyst is designed to be used by both Diageo employees and our key agency partners to build optimised marketing plans and speed up decision making.

answers.text: Diageo colleagues only
Diageo colleagues and key agency partners
Agency partners and clients
Customers

questionData.qText:
Which of the following are examples of Growth Drivers?
Select all that apply.
questionData.fbText: A Growth Driver is a set of activities that you are going to execute during the year, and which will drive mental and physical availability.

questionData.qText: What contributes to the accuracy of the commercial impact predictions?
questionData.fbText: The better the data, the more accurate the commercial impact will be.

answers.text: Better Growth Drivers
Better data
Better clients
Better products

questionData.qText: What will happen if we don’t consider a balance between the short-term and long-term?
questionData.fbText: If a consumer hasn’t heard or seen our brands for three months or more, they are likely to forget about them. The long-term impact will also be affected, as there is no positive long-term impact without a postive short-term impact.

answers.text: Consumers may forget about our brands if we stop communicating with them
The impact on brand sales may be affected in the short-term if we only concentrate in the long-term
We will have a shorter reach to future buyers
Customers will decrease price

questionData.qText: Which of the following make up the performance equation?
questionData.fbText: The performance equation is made of three parts: Gross Profit growth plus Brand Equity growth plus Market Share growth

answers.text: Gross Profit growth
ROI growth
Brand Equity growth
Market Share growth

questionData.qText: What do we mean by marginal gains?
questionData.fbText: Marginal gains are the small improvements we make on every activity or process at work, that when added up make a big difference.

answers.text: Processes and investment opportunities
Consumer sales
Small improvements made on every activity and process at work
Focus on the big changes to marketing campaigns for the greatest impact

questionData.qText: What do we mean by short-term impact on brand sales?
questionData.fbText: Short-term impact typically lasts from 3 to 12 months and is all about the immediate drinks won as a result of implementing a Growth Driver.

answers.text: The potential drinks to be won as a result of implementing a Growth Driver
The immediate drinks won as a result of implementing a Growth Driver
The drinks won in six months' time as a result of implementing a Growth Driver

questionData.qText: Which of the following could contribute to achieving Peak Performance?
questionData.fbText: One of the key ways to achieve Peak Performance is to focus on the small improvements we make on every activity or process, which collectively will make a big difference. Aligning the timing of activations and having an 'always-on' A&P strategy can help to amplify/increase ROI, and using more cost-efficient formats can typically deliver the best returns.

answers.text: Aligning the timing of activations across media, BTL and C&E
Having an “always-on” A&P strategy
Keeping communications within specific teams to minimise disruption to others
Using more cost efficient formats (shorter TV copy, smaller OOH formats)

questionData.qText:
Which of the following does the statement below describe?
'The effect of the immediate drinks won as a result of implementing a Growth Driver'.
questionData.fbText: Short-term Gross Profit ROI means the immediate impact on incremental gross profit as a result of implementing a Growth Driver.

answers.text: Marginal Gross Profit ROI
Long-term Gross Profit ROI
Short-term Gross Profit ROI

questionData.qText:
Which of the following decisions will help us to drive Peak Performance?
Select all that apply.
questionData.fbText: Peak Performance is about making the very best use of available resources to deliver results both in the short and long term. This may include reallocating funds to different activities or focusing on what our activities will deliver both today and tomorrow.

answers.text: Focus on what our activities will deliver today
Focus on what our activities will deliver today and tomorrow
Reallocate funds to drive profits
Make cuts to drive profit

questionData.qText:
What questions can we ask to better understand A&P ROI?
Select all that apply.
questionData.fbText: Asking all of these questions will help us to better understand the A&P ROI.

answers.text: What is the short and long-term impact on brand sales?
What if we adjust the phasing?
What if we change the mix of activities in the Growh Driver?
What caused the results?

questionData.qText: What do the grey arrows next to the Growth Driver in the Marketing Catalyst Growth Driver Module indicate?
questionData.fbText: A grey arrow lets you know that you are currently working at the optimum level, so any further increases in spend from this point will reduce your ROI.

answers.text: That if you spend more, you'll increase your ROI
That if you spend more you'll diminish ROI
That you are currently working at the optimum level
That you need to change the timing of the activity

questionData.qText: What months does the timeline run from at the bottom of the Marketing Catalyst GDM?
questionData.fbText: The timeline works as a calendar by using our financial year from July to June.

answers.text: January - December
April-March
June-July
July-June

pages.title: Introduction
pages.body:
Welcome to the Diageo Marketing Catalyst Growth Driver Module (GDM) game! Your task is to fly through the dataverse collecting good data for the Marketing Catalyst GDM to improve your marketing business plans.

Be careful though, you need to avoid the bad data and other obstacles to keep your confidence ratings high and to earn the most gross profit!

pages.title: How to play
pages.body:
Desktop: Use the up and down cursors to move your player.

Touch: Tap the top and bottom of the screen to move your player.

pages.title: Collectibles
pages.body:
Fill up your meter with as much good data as you can. Try to avoid collecting bad data!

Remember, more good data will give you more chance of success.

pages.title: 4 key ingredients
pages.body: Collect as many of the four key ingredients as you can - when combined they are a powerful concoction to help boost your performance!

pages.title: Test your knowledge
pages.body: Once you've filled up on data, test your knowledge to add it to the growth driver tool. Answer each question correctly to boost your score, your forecasting skills and long term profit growth!

pages.body:
It looks like you've been knocked out of the game by trolls!
